result.execSummary:
The defendant Chadwick V Sciame was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chadwick V Sciame is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chadwick V Sciame was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of  $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
 plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--to any other undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No contact with Anita Sciame, except for divorce or court proceedings and/or with Agent Approval
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

The Court does NOT order Mr. Sciame to submit a DNA sample because he has previously done so

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: with JI's and criminal case settlement

Case called at 10:32am [mo]
Defendant Chadwick V Sciame in court with Attorney John Robert Dade.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Dade indicates that a resolution has been met.
recess:10:33am --reconvene: 10:45am [to allow the Court to hear other cases]

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #2;
Atty. Dade indicates that the Defense only stipulates to some of the facts, but that the facts stipulated to adhere to the charge.
The Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
The Court finds that Mr. Sciame is a repeater and that this is domestic abuse in nature

On Joint Motion of the Parties, the Court dismisses Count #1.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Sciame

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to any other undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No contact with Anita Sciame, except for divorce or court proceedings and/or with Agent Approval
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay costs of  $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge

The Court does NOT order Mr. Sciame to submit a DNA sample because he has previously done so
Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess: 11:15am
Request to change the no contact order is denied
Letter from victim ref bond restrictions

Case called at 9:32am [mo]
Defendant Chadwick V Sciame in court with Attorney John Robert Dade.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Dade indicates that a resolution has not been met at this time, requests additional status
ADA Shock suggests also scheduling a PreTrial Conference.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess: 9:36am

NEXT: (1) PreTrial Conference: 9/9/15 at 1:00pm (2) Status Conference: 9/15/15 at 10:00am
to only Surety listed on the bond - per 6/22/15 court order.

Case called at 8:33 am [sf]
Defendant Chadwick V Sciame in court with Attorney John Robert Dade. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ verifies that there is victim compliance for today's hearing.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Sciame waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver finds that it is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived

Attorney Dade orally motions the court for a bond modification regarding the no contact with Ms. Sciame.
DA Happ presents argument against modification of the bond.
Court presents basis and modifies the bond to a $5,000.00 signature bond with previous non-monetary conditions and adds SCRAM as a condition of bond.
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 6/22/15 at 1:30 pm.  

Court orders the cash bond be refunded to surety.

recess: 8:51 am
NEXT: (Notice to be mailed)
PTC: 78/15 at 9:40 am
Status: 7/21/15 at 9:30 am
Letter dated 5-29-2015 - Courts response-This is an impropoer 3rd party (and exparte) approach to the Court. No action will be taken.
Letter from the victim ref bond conditions
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
original bond document received from JESO on 5/19/15

case called at 1:30 pm. [mo]
Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch II Intake 
Defendant Chadwick V Sciame appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (Bond Purposes Only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Sciame is not eligible for PD representation

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to Counsel given; Atty. Zarwell directed to provide Mr. Sciame with Petition for Court appointed Counsel 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

Bond arguments given by Counsel 

The Court requires a $750  cash bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--No contact with Anita Sciame
--No discussion of the case with A.C.S or D.V.S.
--Not to be in the presence of A.C.S. or D.V.S. unless absolutely sober
--Mr. Sciame may return one time to to the residence shared with Anita Sciame to obtain possessions, if accompianed by law enforcement.
recess 1:38  pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing: June 22, 2015 at 8:30am
